references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational concept of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), which are central to the GREAT Score methodology for approximating unknown data distributions.

references.paper_title: Reliable evaluation of adversarial robustness with an ensemble of diverse parameter-free attacks
references.reason: This paper presents AutoAttack, a state-of-the-art attack method used as a benchmark comparison for the GREAT Score's efficiency and accuracy in evaluating model robustness.

references.paper_title: Robustbench: a standardized adversarial robustness benchmark
references.reason: This paper introduces RobustBench, a large-scale standardized adversarial robustness benchmark against which the GREAT Score is extensively evaluated and compared.

references.paper_title: Towards deep learning models resistant to adversarial attacks
references.reason: This paper is highly influential in the field of adversarial robustness, providing a strong theoretical foundation and practical methods for assessing and improving model resilience to adversarial attacks.

This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a type of generative model used in the ablation study of GREAT Score, showcasing its effectiveness with various generative models.
